1.text: Use a roll of paper towels if you want to make disposable wipes.

2.text: Go with washable cotton cloths if you prefer a reusable option.

3.text: Buy a tall, rectangular plastic container with a lid for an easy solution.

4.text: Try a large glass container with an airtight lid if you don’t use plastic.

5.text: Go with zip-top baggie for a convenient and portable option.

6.text: Mix the warm water, isopropyl alcohol, and dish soap in a bowl.

7.text: Add 10 drops of essential oil for scent and antibacterial properties, if desired.

8.text: Place the wipes into your chosen storage container.

9.text: Pour the cleaning solution over the wipes to saturate them.

10.text: Pull out the cardboard roll if you’re using paper towels.

11.text: Keep the airtight lid closed so the wipes don’t dry out.

12.text: Grab the innermost wipe and pull up to remove it from the container.

13.text: Use your wipes on hard surfaces to clean and disinfect them.
